Transcript: Jack: How does it feel, man? Five minutes till we open the doors.
Jamal: Oh, man. I still cannot believe we pulled it off.

Jack: Oh, hell of a thing your friends 
pitching in to help us pass inspection.

Jamal: Oh, man, yeah. Tell me about it. I mean, when Alison -- when she 
sprained her ankle, man -- I thought it was over.
Jack: Where is she, anyway?

Jamal: Oh, she'll be here. She said she has something to do first. I don't 
know.
Jack: I just didn't think she'd miss something like this.

Jamal: Yeah, yeah. What about Livvie? I thought for sure she'd be dropping by 
first thing in the morning, checking things out.
Jack: Yeah, I don't think so.

Jamal: Oh, come on, dude. I saw you guys working yesterday, and I was 
definitely getting a vibe between you two.

Jack: Yeah? So was I. Till she put up that big wall she puts up -- you know, 
her usual M.O.
Jamal: Hey, man, what's up with that?

Jack: Honestly, I don't care. I basically told her to have a nice life. 
Besides, man, forget about all that. It's showtime, baby. Let's go, open up, 
open up.

Jamal: Easy, easy, man. Come on. It's not like there's a big line of people 
waiting outside my --
Jack: No?
Jamal: Door.
Amanda: Hello, Jamal.

Jamal: Well, I guess you're here to gloat, right, Granny? Ahem. Well, guess 
again.
Lucy: Oh, wait. Here. Hey. Here. I can help you. Let me help.

Alison: Oh, no. Actually, Lucy, I got this part, but could you get the door 
for me, please?

Lucy: Yeah. Wait, don't tell me you deliver now? This is so great. I don't 
cook!

Alison: Oh, no. No, actually, we don't. It's just it's the opening day at the 
bike shop, you know, so I'm just bringing some --
Lucy: Oh, the bike --
Alison: Coffee for the guys.

Lucy: Yeah, that's right. I heard about that. I heard about that. I heard 
about the bike shop.
Alison: Yeah, it's going to be fun. You should stop by.
Lucy: Yeah, I will. You know, I would like to see it.
Alison: Ok.

Victor: So we're all set? That's excellent! All we have to do is wait for the 
word from Ian. Now, Pete -- no, no, no, no. I'll be in touch with you. And, 
Pete? Nobody -- that means nobody -- can know about this. No, no, I know you do. 
And thanks for all your good work.
Lucy: Know about what?
Victor: Lucy.
Lucy: What's the big secret?
Ian: We need to talk.
Eve: I said what I had to say last night.
Ian: And do you really believe that -- that I won't be able to leave Arianna?

Eve: After everything she's gone through, we -- yeah, it's not that hard to 
imagine.
Ian: Hey. I promise you, we're going to be together.
Eve: I want to believe that, Ian. I really do. But maybe now isn't our time.
Ian: Come with me.
Eve: Where are you going? What are you doing?
Ian: This is our time. I'll make it our time.
Amanda: I came to see my granddaughter.
Jamal: What, after all the trouble you caused?
Amanda: I have no idea what you're talking about.
Jamal: Granny, come on. Don't try to con a con.
Amanda: I assure you --

Jamal: Let me fill in the blanks. All right, you sent a building inspector on 
us to try to shut us down.

Amanda: You give me far too much credit. I simply came by to wish you both 
well in your new venture.
Jamal: That's the only reason why you came by?
Amanda: And to extend an invitation.
Jamal: An invitation.
Amanda: An old family friend of Alison's came back into town.
Jamal: So?

Amanda: I'm planning to give a dinner party in Chad's honor, and I would like 
for you both to come.
Alison: Yeah, right. When hell freezes over.
Woman: Hmm. Nice rump lights.
Jack: Thanks. I'm fixing her up for resale.
Woman: Jamal around?
Jack: He's -- he's a little busy, but --
Woman: Samantha. But you can call me Sam.
Jack: I'm Jack. Maybe I can help you out.
Sam: I bet you can.

Jack's Voice: Livvie, do you want to let one stupid night -- when I got drunk 
and nothing happened -- stand in the way of us being together? Or do you want to 
let yourself feel all the good stuff that you really feel?
[Doorbell rings]
Livvie: Oh, hi.
Kevin: This a bad time?

Livvie: No, actually. Grandma's out with the nurse, and I was just -- why 
don't you come on in?

Kevin: Thanks. I'm sorry I didn't call first. I was in the neighborhood, and 
-- to be honest, I've missed you.
Livvie: So I heard you and Lucy got back together.

Kevin: Yeah. And I know you're still angry at her for what happened with 
Jack.

Livvie: Well, maybe you can get over her and Jack being together, but I 
can't.

Kevin: Well, try and remember there were extenuating circumstances. First, 
you and I had just broken up with them both. Second, they didn't know who each 
other were. And, third, they'd done a fair amount of drowning their sorrows -- 
over us.
Livvie: And, four, you were all keeping it from me.

Kevin: So we're hereby convicted of being flawed human beings and therefore 
banished from your life. Is that how it works? Livvie, I know a lot of people 
have let you down, but if you start closing the door on everyone who makes a 
mistake, the world is going to get pretty lonely pretty fast.

Victor: Lucy, I'm so glad to see you because maybe I won't forget again that 
Mary wants to have you and Monk come over for dinner. Any night would be good. 
Except Monday -- Mary works Mondays, and Wednesdays I have my Toastmasters. 
Fridays -- but Fridays we just started our bambuca classes. Bambuca, of course, 
is the national ballroom dance of Colombia. You know, you and Monk really ought 
to take advantage of their trial class -- no obligation -- because you're tall. 
And bambuca is a --

Lucy: Stop, Victor. Just stop. You're changing the subject. You know me 
better than that. I will get back to the subject I want to speak about, so let's 
do it now.
Victor: What?

Lucy: You know what I'm talking about -- Ian. There is some sort of big thing 
going on with Ian, and I want to know what it is, and no one will tell me, which 
makes me more determined to find out what it is, so just tell me.
Victor: Lucy, hush.
Lucy: What?
Victor: Stop.
[Lucy sighs]
Lucy: Ugh.

Victor: This is one time in your life when you need to pull back because this 
is much too complicated and very dangerous. For your own good, M.Y.O.B.
Lucy: M.Y.O. what?
Victor: Mind your own business. And I mean it, Lucy.
Lucy: All right, Victor. Saturday. Saturday's perfect. Can you tell Mary?
Victor: Saturday would be fine.
Lucy: Great! Good. Ooh, gosh.
Arianna: Oh, excuse me.
Lucy: Oh, sorry. It was totally my fault.
Arianna: Lucy, right?
Lucy: Yeah, that's -- that's right. That's me.

Arianna: Oh, you probably don't remember me. I'm Arianna -- Ian Thornhart's 
wife.

Lucy: You know, of course I remember you because you are Ian Thornhart's 
wife. How -- how is Ian -- my good, good friend Ian -- these days, huh?
Eve: Oh, I love you so much. I'm so afraid.
Ian: Afraid of what?
Eve: That this is getting away from us. Somehow we're losing control.
Ian: I'm losing control right now.

Eve: No, no, I'm serious. Wait. Wait. Last night this couple came into the 
ER. And every time he tells her that he wants out of the marriage, she hurts 
herself. So now he's stuck in this loveless marriage.
Ian: The way I'm stuck with Arianna.

Eve: I'm afraid you're never going to leave her. And not -- not because -- 
look, I'm afraid that you are worried that she won't be ok without you. And I 
know this is not her fault, but this situation is just taking on a life of its 
own.
Ian: We just have to be patient.

Eve: She told you she loves you. The longer this goes on, the harder it's 
going to be for everyone.
Ian: If I could be with you right now, I would be. You know that.
Eve: I know, I do. But there's one thing I can't get out of my head.
Ian: And what's that?

Eve: Arianna is your wife, and you share everything with her, and she is this 
beautiful, amazing woman who loves you and adores you, and she, most of all, 
needs you. She needs you, and I'm me.

Livvie: How do I let go when every time I remember I just get angry all over 
again?

Kevin: It's not easy. Take it from me and Lucy. But one thing we've gotten 
better at is learning how to look past the mistakes to what's really important.
Livvie: That you two really love each other.
Kevin: And we've been able to do that by learning how to forgive.

Livvie: All right. What do you do when -- when your head tells you one thing, 
but your heart completely tells you something else?
Kevin: Well, that's easy. Go with your heart. It'll never steer you wrong.
[Pager beeps]
Kevin: Oh. That's an emergency. I have to go.
Livvie: Ok.
Kevin: Try and remember that. Follow your heart.
Sam: I'm running a little hot. Anything you can do to help me?
Jack: Yeah, I'm sure I can think of one or two things.
[Telephone rings]
Jack: Hold on one sec. Hello?
[Livvie hangs up]
Jack: Hmm. Guess they had the wrong number. Now, where were we?
Sam: I believe you were about to take me for a test drive.

Amanda: Alison, I -- I don't understand you. Chad is a good friend, and he's 
expecting you.
Alison: Well, I don't care.
Amanda: So what am I supposed to do? Leave Chad hanging?

Alison: Actually, that's very funny -- hanging Chad. But, no, Nana, we're 
still not coming to dinner.

Amanda: I was so hoping we'd get a chance to -- to make things right between 
us again.
Alison: I'm sorry. After this last stunt you pulled, I don't think so.
Amanda: What stunt?
Alison: Look, Nana, I just want you to be gone and stay gone, ok?
Amanda: That girl is impossible.
Jamal: Yeah, well, you pushed her away.

Amanda: I know my granddaughter, and she -- she can't turn her back on her 
family for long.
Jamal: Look, you're not her family anymore. I am.
Amanda: And what happens when you get tired of her?

Jamal: Look, I won't get tired of Alison. Not ever. So unless you got a bike 
that needs fixing --
[Door closes]
Alison: So, anyways -- I'm sorry. So -- Sam, was it?
Sam: Yeah, that's right.
Alison: Yeah.
Sam: And Jack here was about to check out my ride.
Alison: Oh, right. I'm sure he was.
Jack: I'll -- I'll just meet you over by your bike. All right?
Alison: I'm sorry. What's with you and leather slut, huh?
Jack: Hey, hey, chill out. She's a customer. I'm just taking care of her.
Alison: Oh, I'm sure you are!
Jack: Hey, I'll just go in and get my helmet and then I'll be right over.

Sam: I found your friend Jamal. No, come by yourself. He's here. Me? I'm just 
getting to know the staff.

Lucy: I have to tell you, you know, you really hit the jackpot with Ian. He's 
quite a catch.

Arianna: Oh, he's much more than that. You know, he's kind and sensitive and 
caring.

Lucy: Aw, that is just so sweet. It sounds like you're still in the honeymoon 
phase, so everything's just perfect, huh?
Arianna: Well, we did have our first little misunderstanding last night.

Lucy: Oh, no. I'm so sorry. You know, these little misunderstandings happen 
in a new marriage -- especially a new marriage that was so sudden.

Arianna: It was sudden, and I know some of Ian's friends must be concerned, 
but they needn't be. Ian and I are going to have a long and happy life together. 
I'm sure of it.
Lucy: Oh. Goody.
Victor: Josie asked me to bring this over to you.
Arianna: Oh. Thank you.
Victor: Better hold the bottom.

Arianna: Ok. Oh, it was so nice talking to you. I'd better get these to my 
husband before they get cold.

Lucy: Oh, yeah. Ok. Tell your husband hi for me, please. Tell him hi. Ok, 
take care.
Arianna: Bye.
Victor: What are you doing?
Lucy: Nothing.

Victor: That's good, because I'd hate to think that you were poking your nose 
into Ian's business just minutes after I asked you not to.

Lucy: Look, you. I may not know what's going on with Ian because some people 
don't want to tell me, but what I do know is Ian is in love with Eve, and Eve is 
in love with Ian, and that that Mrs. Thornhart person -- she hasn't gotten the 
message yet, obviously. So whatever you are doing, whatever you're cooking up, 
you'd better do it quickly, Victor, I'm telling you, or somebody's going to take 
a great big fall here.
Ian: Let me tell you something, Lambert. You are all I want, all I need.
Eve: Ian, you --

Ian: Not just because of those beautiful, beautiful eyes and that incredible 
smile, those luscious lips. But because there's a strength in you like I've 
never seen, and that's what makes me love you more than anything.
Eve: I love you so much it scares me to death.

Ian: You don't have to be scared of nothing. I told you. What we went through 
on that island -- the only thing I learned from that is that we are meant to be 
together.
Eve: But the chief said --

Ian: Ah, don't worry about what the chief said. You believe what's in your 
heart. You believe that I love you, don't you, and that you're everything to me?

Eve: No, this is not good -- I mean, being this close to you and not being 
able to be with you. I can't do it. I can't do it anymore. I'm leaving.
Ian: But I'm not letting you go.
Eve: Ian, I --
Ian: I'm not going to lose you. Not now, not ever.

Eve: Oh, God. Ok, this is killing me. We have to stop. You have to go. I 
can't do this anymore.
Ian: All right. Try not to --

Eve: Listen, I can't help but worry. No matter what you say, Ian, I'm 
terrified of losing you.
Ian: You won't.
Eve: Ok.
Alison: I thought that, like, Nana would never leave.

Jamal: Yeah, well, it wasn't before letting me know that this is your last 
chance to make peace with your family.
Alison: I know.
Jamal: Ali, I think she's serious.

Alison: Look, Jamal, listen. I have my friends and I have my life, and most 
importantly, I have you. Ok?
Jamal: All right. Hey.
Alison: What?

Jamal: You know I'll always be there for you, don't you, Spunky? I'll never 
let you down.
Alison: Yeah, yeah, I do.
Jamal: Ok.
Alison: Where is all this coming from?

Jamal: Nowhere. I just -- I want you to know I'm in this for keeps -- all 
right? -- And that I love you.
Alison: I love you, too.
Livvie: Ahem.
Alison: Livvie. Hi.
Livvie: Sorry. Sorry to interrupt.
Alison: No, no, you didn't.
Livvie: Hey, is Jack around? I wanted to talk to him.
Alison: Yeah, he is.
Jamal: He's --
Alison: I think he's out there fixing a bike or --

Sam: Hey, anyone see Jack's gloves? Here they are. By the way, don't expect 
Jack back anytime soon.
Jamal: Why is that?
Sam: Our test drive may take a while.
Livvie: Who was that?
Alison: It was Pam or -- Sam. Sam.
Livvie: What, Jack's going out with her?

Alison: Well, Livvie, I mean, you just -- you, like, blew him off so many 
times that I think that he maybe just --
[telephone rings]
Alison: Bike shop.
Victor: I don't understand. Why do you want to hold? We're all set to go.

Ian: I appreciate your help, Victor. I will let you know if anything changes. 
Thanks.
Lucy: Ian. Hi.
Ian: Lucy, hi. How are you?
Lucy: I'm great, actually. By the by, I -- I just spoke with your wife.
Ian: Did you? Whiskey, large glass, no ice. Thank you.

Lucy: So the question of the day is, how are you going to dig yourself out of 
this one?
Eve: Arianna? Are you all right?
Arianna: Not really.
Eve: Well, what's wrong?
Arianna: I want you to stay away from my husband.
>> On the next "Port Charles" --

Lucy: I've known Eve a long time, and she's not going to just wait around 
forever, you know.
Arianna: It's only natural Ian wants to be with you.
Eve: But?
Arianna: But we both know I can't let him go.
